### THIS IS DIFFERENT!!!

**This exercise is different from all your past work!** That's on purpose! Only HTML output can handle interactivity and dashboardsâ€”PDFs and Word files are static document formats that don't allow Javascript.

For this exercise you'll get to practice making interactive plots and dashboards! You'll do it by creating a Quarto website and publishing it on the internet. That might sound intimidating and hard, but **don't worry!** Thanks to Quarto (and the starter code and detailed instructions I provide), it should be fairly straightforward.

Complete instructions for the different tasks are [at this website](https://andrewheiss.quarto.pub/datavizsp26_11-exercise-recreate/). Use the top navigation bar there to look at the different pages:

- [{{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} Exercise 11 instructions + how to submit](https://andrewheiss.quarto.pub/datavizsp26_11-exercise-recreate/instructions.html)

## Instructions

1. Open the project either on your computer or in Posit.cloud

   - [{{< fa file-archive >}} `11-exercise.zip`](/projects/11-exercise.zip): If you're using R on your own computer, download this file, [*unzip it*](/resource/unzipping.qmd), and double click on the file named `11-exercise.Rproj`
   - [{{< fa cloud >}} Posit.cloud project](https://posit.cloud/spaces/679548/content/11298617): Use this link if you're using Posit.cloud in your browser

2. Follow [the instructions here](https://andrewheiss.quarto.pub/datavizsp26_11-exercise-recreate/instructions.html) and complete the different tasks in the different `.qmd` files. Check [the data description](https://andrewheiss.quarto.pub/datavizsp26_11-exercise-recreate/) to learn more about what all the columns mean.

3. When you're all done, [follow the instructions about publishing the site](https://andrewheiss.quarto.pub/datavizsp26_11-exercise-recreate/instructions.html#publishing-the-site-and-submitting-to-icollege). **Do not try to render as PDF or Word.** In iCollege, paste the URL of your website into the submission form.
